text: I usually eat here after partying along the strip of bars down the street. The burritos are BOMB and I am always in the mood for one. My go to is the steak with everything in it. Delish! The only downfall that I do not like for this restaurant specifically is that they do not carry green salsa AT ALL. No salsa verde in a Mexican restaurant ?!?! I literally will never understand. It makes absolutely no sense to me and it is my favorite kind of salsa. It compliments all Hispanic foods perfectly ! This is the only place I will eat a burrito without green salsa. The red is very VERY hot but not unbearable. GET SOME GREEN SALSA YOU GUYS !!!!!

Excellent food, I'm a local and I've been to countless Mexican places in the city and this place is among the best food for the money.  Not a lot of ambience as it's a quick and simple place but it's always clean and tidy.  Their salsa is fantastic and all of the food that I've had has been very good.  Very much will go again.

First things first, this Allende is SO MUCH BETTER than the one further down the street on Lincoln. I've been coming here since I was a little girl and now that I'm older I keep coming back to Allende at least once or twice a month. I am in love with their salsa and the tacos are always good to me. I love the horchatas! The people that work there are so nice to everyone. They advertise as not having a restroom, but I've asked nicely before and they let me go to the back. They are so cheap, yet delicious and they are prettt much always open! The only thing bad I have to say is that sometimes when I order fries they come out really greasy and nasty.
Finally, I've found a place in Chicago that rivals the taco shops of Southern California. Perfectly seasoned meats and tacos that are fresh and delicious.

This hidden gem is no frills but no frills are needed! Their food is AMAZING! Some of the best tacos I've ever had (drunk and sober). One of my favorite spots and everyone there is always very friendly and nice! I always leave happy!!

Allende totally nails it when I'm craving cheap, authentic, quality Mexican food. $2 for a steak taco, it can't be beat. It's a total no frills place, with fresh Mexican staples. Don't come here looking for fancy tacos.

I would never go there if I had any other options. I ordered a burrito and asked for extra sauce. Did not know they charged for extra sauce. The horchata tasted like some instant made horchata. The burrito is overloaded with lettuce, little meat, and less cheese and beans. When she handed me my change, she made a comment about forgetting to charge me for the extra sauce. She grabbed the change out of my palm. Food sucks, service sucks. Maybe if I was drunk, I'd go there for food, but again, everything tastes decent when one's drunk.

Ordered al pastor tacos and they were delicious. Great price for good quality authentic Mexican food (as far as the al pastor tacos go anyway). Will definitely come back and recommend to those looking for some real authentic Mexican food.
Can't beat this place. Great food, great deal. Every time. All the tacos are great, but I recommend the vegetarian taco... with a side of al pastor and chicken!

Okay, seriously, I don't really like tacos, but this place has me IN LOVE with tacos. The chicken is so great, the tacos are filled perfectly with meat and veggies. I always leave happy. I'm so glad this place is in my life!
No frills Mexican restaurant located about two miles from Lincoln Park Zoo. Complete dinners for $10. Great spot for basic Mexican meals.

Looking for a big ass, greasy burrito to soak up that booze and get you home safe?  This is the place to go in Lincoln Park.  I've been to quite a few taco joints in the area, but this is my go-to.  You may have to dodge the late night crowd on the weekends, but that should be expected.

Im from the south side by pulaski where there is at least 20 taco places in a 15 block radias and i have tried them all imust say these tacos are good and fresh and the cheese fries were goid too but if you are not a hot fan the salsa will sizzle the lips off you i loved it at 1 in the morning
They make their tacos with love, great steak tacos! Although, the people could be nicer, the quality of the tacos make me overlook the dry customer service

Had to give them 5 stars although I've only visited once. Had the steak burrito and fries following the recommendation of a previous reviewer. Fabulous. Now the place is very basic and they don't have a restroom which isn't uncommon for small restaurants in Chicago. But I came hear to eat and they hit it out of the park.

VERY GOOD FOOD, but the dining experience can be lackluster.  I've eaten here 50+ times after work (not late night).   1.  Again, the food is quite good; I love the enchiladas and the chips and salsa are good too. 2.  The dining area has for many months smelled like bleach with a hint of sewage. 3.  Some of the waitresses are very nice; but others will nickel and dime you on anything that you ask for after receiving your order. If they got rid of that smell (which has caused me to go here twice a year instead of 30 times a year); I would bump this up to 4 stars.  And if one of their servers stopped nickel and diming their customers, I'd bump it up to 5 stars.

My absolute favorite chicken tacos in all of Chicago. I go through streaks where I eat Allende 3 or 4 times a week for dinner. I had my first Torta here almost 20 years ago. Open late & always great anytime of the day. My favorite

Allende is the Jam! I live around the corner and have hit this place up for years for fast, inexpensive,  and delicious food.  Goto menu items: Steak burrito(no lettuce, add avacado) & fries :)  The tostadas are really good The nachos are unique and delicious!  Awesome hot sauce too!

The Mexican Chorizo here is the BEST.   Love the flavors.   I would skip the chicken as it is usually pretty dry.   Stick with the fattier meats - al pastor, steaks, chorizo.   Can't go wrong.     I usually swing in here as it is down the street for me for a quick dinner option and never am disappointing.   I also hear its open till like 4am, which is just absurd.   I couldn't imagine what the clientele is like after 1am... FYI, all the bad reviews here are from the drunkies - don't let them stop you from checking out this hole in the wall.

We make a day of it. Stop at Allende, go to Swirlz around the corner, visit the Zoo. This is our favorite stop for tacos, hands down. Best in the entire North side of Chicago (that we have tried) and staff is always friendly. Can't wait to stop in again, soon!

I'm not giving this place one star only because their horchata is surprisingly good (it's called rice drink on their menu?), but that's the only positive thing about this restaurant I can review. Also, this place has no restrooms so make sure you pee before coming! My friends and I stopped by here because we were tipsy and just wanted to eat whatever was close by/open at 4am. We stumbled upon this restaurant. So Cal people know that after clubbing you either go for late night pho or late night Mexican food. The place was filled up so I figured why not. I ordered two tacos (carne asada and al pastor)...boy...was I sorely disappointed. The meat was burnt to crisp and the salsa was bland. I tried to look for any redeeming pieces, but found none. I couldn't even finish the second taco. I definitely do not recommend coming here for late night drunches.
So so good, and can't beat the price. Tostadas are amazing, tacos and nachos as well.
They don't grill onions (WTF?), and there veggie selection taps out at guac, onions, tomatoes, lettuce, beans and rice.  - Get some greens and grill 'em!  Also a little dingy inside.

i love eating there!! sure there sometimes rude, but they only treat you the way you treat them. and if you have a problem with the whole bathroom thing then go somewhere else! simple!!! buy law!!! they don't have to allow people to use the bathroom, if there restaurant could hold more then 50 people they had to open there bathrooms, but since it does not!!!!! that law does not apply to them.

Best Chicken Tacos in Chicago, pretty good prices. This location on 2200 N Lincoln has better tacos than the location on 2400 N Lincoln. A lot of people think this is just drunk college student food but their tacos are seriously great & the best i've had in the city. They don't have a public restroom but I go into several hole in the walls that don't so that doesn't bug me as an issue. There are 2 women that work the counter, one is nice and the other can be an asshole lol but i've gone so much that we have good rapport now

Not sure what everyone is talking about - I found the service to be quite friendly and the vegetarian burrito was not more expensive. That was what I ended up getting, and it was exceptionally large and pretty delicious. The ingredients themselves were not exceptional - rice, beans, cheese, lettuce, avocado - but the house-made hot sauce (that you have to ask for) was spicy and fantastic, elevating the dish. The only negative thing about this place was a bunch of drunk obnoxious kids who stopped by after Lollapalooza and insisted on having a loud discussion about all their friend group drama, which is not the fault of the restaurant. One thing to watch out for is there seem to be multiple locations near by on both Yelp and Uber, so our pickup driver went to the wrong place. Not sure what's going on there.

Food is fine. Being charged extra money to have less food in your burrito is not. $11 for a vegetarian breakfast burrito when the meat option is $7?! Not ok. Thanks for the mediocre food, unfriendly service and for overcharging me.

There are two locations of Allende within like a 5min walk of each other on Lincoln Ave. Not sure if/how they're related. This one is near the Lincoln/Fullerton/Halsted intersection, and I can't speak for the other one.  I can't deny it would make awesome cheap drunk food, but I have definitely only eaten here  sober, during daylight hours, chosen it over other restaurants that are still open... And it's delicious. If I'm starving and need food asap, I'd love nothing more than a giant burrito from Allende. Al pastor or carne asada with everything. For like ~$5. Stuffed. Rice and beans, pretty standard. The only thing I wouldn't get again is their lengua... a bit dry and flavorless, and it's easy to find better versions at similar restaurants. Personally, I'd rather take out than eat here. The ambiance is very hole in the wall. Booth seats, but most are so close to the backroom that it smells like wet mop/cleaning supplies/dirty mop bucket - not smells you'd want to inhale along with your food. But the food is super yums and a great value.

A classic case of "our food is so good that we can be an asshole to you" syndrome. I read the other reviews and was a bit dubious, but I started coming here, and while the food is delicious and quite cheap, the claims of rude service are spot on. Furthermore, they claim to not have a bathroom and get mad if you try to use it. Now, I get it, they want to dis-incentivize drunk college kids from stopping by just to use their bathroom. But still, it shouldn't be a struggle or even a conversation for a paying customer to use the bathroom. Hey Allende, by prohibiting the use of the bathroom, you're in violation of Illinois statute 410 ILCS 39/10!!

Honestly, I've never written in a yelp review- I've never had a reason to. Loved restaurants, restaurants were fine. But wow. This place is tainted by one individual. Extreme but true. The cashier women is so rude and unprofessional it is reason to never return.
first time at allende. basing this review solely on service and the nachos with steak. affordable and outstanding!

Tacos were amazing. Not sure if the hot sauce was home made, but it had just the right amount of kick. The issue I had with this place was that they didn't have anywhere for you to wash your hands, and they also didn't offer hand sanitizer. As a restaurant, their should be some incentive for you to provide your customers with a place for them to wash their hands. After I asked the worker for a place to wash my hands, she simply said that,"we don't let people in the back and that we don't have any hand sanitizer left". She did try to resolve the issue by giving me a slightly wet towel with soap on it, which I didn't deem appropriate but commend her for trying to come up wit a resolution. I probably won't be back.

I am a student at Lincoln Park High School and Allende restaurant is one of my personal favorites for lunch! I usually order the two steak tacos with chips and salsa! The service is quick and the food is good! It's inexpensive and convenient if you want some inexpensive Mexican food.

HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE! I wish there was an optional for no stars. I used to come to this specific location pretty often when I used to go to Lincoln Park high school. Allende had great mexican food with kinds workers at an affordable price, but I don't know what happened to that now. The lady that took my order was rude, ignorant, racist and was just a complete bitch for no reason. I asked if I can use the restroom politely so I can wash my hands since I paid with cash and she responded " NO! RULES HAVE CHANGED AND THE BATHROOM IS FOR WORKERS ONLY." ... okay whatever, so now I guess I'm stuck with eating my tacos with filthy hands AWESOME!!!!!!!! You won't believe what happened next.. I asked for a to go box and she had the nerve to give me a brown paper bag to put my tacos in............... OKAY clearly you're mad at the world and live a miserable life. Never coming here again. Customer service is POOR. Mind you not, she was on her phone the ENTIRE TIME! Sickening.. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE PPL HEAD DOWN THE STREET TO THE ALLENDES ON LINCOLN AND FULLERTON.

I love there nachos it's so good and filling!! They don't skimp on the toppings! My boyfriend always orders the chicken burrito and he loves it... There food is good and prices are pretty decent as well.

If you like tacos, let me tell you something about Allende, they have tacos.  Depending on how much money you have, they will sell you as many tacos as you ask for.  Personally I have not gotten more than 8, but I bet that if I had enough money to buy 20 tacos, they would make them for me.  I love this place.

Not only do the kind employees make a trip to Allende a pleasant experience, the food can speak for itself. Between its fresh ingredients and well portioned and priced options, Allende is a great option for quick affordable Mexican food. My personal favorite are the carne asada tacos with a side of guacamole and chips. Add a little bit of their infamous spicy salsa and you have got yourself the perfect combination of meat and spices!

I heard so much about Allende from my friends, so I decided to give it a whirl one hungry evening. Seeing that the tacos were super cheap, I decided to try the chorizo, carne asada, and the al pastor. They weren't mind blowing and didn't live up to the hype (I did rather like the al pastor; it was savory, moist, tender, and well marinated), but service was quick and friendly and you get the most bang out of your buck. I would MUCH rather eat this than McDonalds next time I'm in need of a quick bite.
Solid, fresh, made to order no-frills Mexican fare. I particularly like their sauce on the huevos rancheros. Great, basic tacos.
The only way to enjoy this food is by numbing your taste buds with a gallon of hot sauce.   By the way, the gaucamole was spoiled.  I had to spit it out and rinse my mouth.  What a dump.

Allende is the best place on earth. The price is right! I have been eating their steak tacos since high school. I am deeply offended when people tell me that they've only eaten there when they are drunk. Their burritos are perfection. Their rice & beans are to die for. And the best part is I never spend more than 10 dollars on a full meal!

I struggle to leave it at 3 stars, but it was fast and I'm full.  I had carne, pollo and picadillo tacos. None of the meat was overly flavorful.  I had a side of salsa, as I always do, in case I need to drench anything in it for flavor.  Their "hot" was steamy hot, so I couldn't use much more than a few drops.  I'm sure some people would love this type of heat.

How have I never reviewed Allende? It has helped me through plenty of lot long nights studying for finals, in cold weather when I lived across the street, and when I was out a little too late partying. I've been coming for 5 years, my bf for well over 10 and we've never had a bad experience. Start with some salsa and chips, they're perfect. The steak tacos are small and delicious. The cheese quesadilla is perfection and the guac and chips are the perfect compliment. I've only had one burrito and it was pretty good as well. Around 2 am on Fridays and 3 am on Saturdays good luck getting into this place. This is the go to place for Lincoln Park kids. It's a way better option than McDonalds to be certain. You can get a decent meal at whatever hour for cheap. This is a local Mexican joint done right and for a good price.

So this place does have good tacos, not the best beans and rice ive ever had, but decent. the tacos and salsa is probally the only reason ive gave them even 2 stars. When you walk in your not greeted or even aknowledged that you came in. And when you go to order your food from the Ghetto girl at the front counter, you get her attitude if you even ask a concerning question about what your about to order. Ive also had an issue with getting chips and salsa. Sometimes they give them to you with your order, sometimes they dont, sometimes they charge you extra, and sometimes they dont give them out past a specific time that seems they just made up because you just asked for them.Overall. not a pleasant experience, wont be going back.

I meant to go to the other one, but me & my boyfriend went to this one on mistake. I had steak nachos & rice water and he had a steak burrito. I thought the food was excellent except I wish it had hot peppers with the nachos. The burrito was huge and I liked that as well. The rice water was too watery and had too much cinnamon.  I didn't like how they had no restroom for customer use and the woman was mopping and using Pine-Sol while we were eating.

Lets put it this way, if Chipotle didn't decide to close at 10pm every night, I would have never ate at this joint. If you're craving some late night Mexican food, this place is ehhhh OK at best. The workers are always grumpy and short with you due to the amount of belligerent kids that come storming in and demanding burritos. Will I eat there ever again? Possibly. Would I recommend this place to you? Probably not.

Allende has been preventing and curing my hangovers for 6 years. It has been a good friend through college, grad school, and pathetic nights trying to relive college by drinking like a linebacker at Halligan. I love a craft taco (e.g., Taco Joint) as much as the next white person, but sometimes you just want it quick, cheap and with no frills. Allende packs a burrito so full, it is amazing. I feel like their chefs could swaddle a baby with great expertise. Everything is cheap, I always spend less than $6 and leave quite satisfied. The cashier is always so nice, considering she has probably dealt with a few unreasonable drunks in her tenure. I recommend Allende for a few functional purposes; getting a good base in your system before drinking, quelling late night hunger, or getting some grease in your system the day after a night of mixing bombs, beer, and god knows what else.

This is a good late-night place to go to if you're in the area on Lincoln Ave and when you're craving some burritos. Fair prices on tacos. Nothing to die for, but the ingredients are fresh and everything is prepared fairly quick. *CPD's finest also like to dine here every now and then.
Slop... + they don't allow their customer to use their restrooms...  Never again.

This place has the best tacos in the area.  It's open late, and super friendly.  The food is fresh, and the prices are low.  No frills at this place- you order at the counter, seat yourself, bus your own table, etc.
Good.  Cheap.  Mexican Food.  Nothing else needs to be said.  I can feed a family of four for $20 and won't hear a complaint.

Delicious, delicious chicken burritos! My friends live right down the street from this Mexican gem, which is fantastic because visiting them almost always results in visiting great Mexican food. Allende covers all my requirements for burritos: they are delicious, inexpensive, and large enough to cradle. Load it up with hot sauce if you're into that, and enjoy!

Wow, I work at Max Bar and frequently visit here after work on the weekends and the staff is great and food is decent but I went in there today and ordered... The girl working there who has red hair and piercings was super rude, on her phone the whole time swearing and acting non professional while taking my order. She repeated my order then still made a mistake. I asked for the missing item and told her I would pay and she said I needed to spend 5$ to use my card. I told her it was her mistake and she said too bad with tons of attitude.. Never once apoligized! Seriously? Tommy

Pro's:  -Convenient hours -Food is made fresh when you order it (and fast!) -The horchata is delicious Con's:  -None of the food I ordered has ever been that great -They won't make some modifications to the menu items (Why can't I have a burrito with chorizo if you have burritos and chorizo??)

5 $ burrito until 3 am? So much food you'll be stuffed for days? Do I need to say more? Well, for those of you who need more this is actually a burrito I choose to get for normal people dinner. That's right, dinner before 10pm because it is that good.

For the past few weekends, I've been coming to Lincoln Park to work at a nearby coffeehouse. But when I'm done sipping so much coffee, I always get hungry and look for somewhere good and affordable to eat.  Enter Allende Restaurant. This is quite possibly one of the cheapest Mexican restaurants in Chicago - nay, in the entire country - for the amount of food you get. If you don't know what to get, I strongly suggest their tortas, which are a version of Mexican tacos that come in the form of a sandwich. Undoubtedly, the best torta is the al pastor one, but the chorizo and steak ones are awesome too.  One of the things that I love about this place is that they cook the food as soon as you order it. That way you know it's fresh and it hasn't been laying around and waiting for next customer.  Allende is not necessarily the best place for a date or for any important meeting. But if you're looking for a cheap place to eat something substantive and on-the-go, I can't recommend Allende enough.

A perfect lil taqueria! Cheap, delicious, pleasant servers! Loved it when I was drunk in college. Unlike other late night spots, though, I still actually enjoy it when I'm in the mood for a calorie splurge.

I am a sucker for cheap Mexican food and Allende did not disappoint! Chips and salsa are complimentary before 2PM although I would have paid for them either way. Tortilla chips were authentic and salsa was yummy. One of the girls I was with ordered the guac and that was delicious as well. I got a steak torta for just $3.75 which is basically all your burrito ingredients on Mexican bread...so good! The bread was different from others I've had in a good way. The cashier recommended the Horchata which I'm glad she did since it was one of the best I've had! I will definitely be returning to Allende soon.

YAY- for delicious, small business, authentic, Mexican food! I saw locals walk in here mid week and I was surprised it was empty! Working in Lincoln Park, save a few dollars by going here instead of the Chipotle chain across the street. 1.75 for a shredded chicken taco, amazing! Completely filling. Food is cooked fresh in front of you in the kitchen. My friends got tostados and burritos and they loved it. We will return and sit at Table number 4! It's not one of  your high quality services but it's a great stop for a quick lunch and the lady that works there is friendly! Menu is huge so take your time deciding what you want! Don't leave this restaurant without trying a Horchata, as Wiki describes it of ground almonds, sesame seeds, rice, barley, or tigernuts (chufas). My friend says she has tried many but that one was of her favorites and it was under 2 bucks! It's my new local fav!

Surprisingly good food with friendly staff at a pretty typical looking taco place.  My quesadillas were outstanding and my wife and daughter scarfed down about 3 each of their mini-tacos.  Total price was less than $20.  I can't remember the last time I fed my family and enjoyed the food for that price point.

1. Vegetarians beware...there is nothing good for you to eat here. The veggie options don't actually have any vegetables in them, just rice and beans! And the rice is not yummy. Sadness. 2. We were charged for the chip and salsa, which wouldn't have been bad if I wasn't expecting them to be free per yelp reviews or if the salsa was actually good, but it wasn't. No heat to it at all.  3. They never brought our drinks. And we were the only ones in the restaurant. Plus side I was told the chicken torta is tasty. Not coming back here, neither should you.
I get their tacos al pastor. It is great for the price, but not the best I've had. The workers are polite and speedy. Always a good experience.

Whats that? You're so inebriated you can barely walk, but that won't stop you from drunk eating at 2:30 AM?  Stumble into Allende! They patiently let you try to use your high school Spanish to order (They speak English, you're just being a drunken tool) and when the food arrives you are so excited you could cry- and you might.   Allende is one of those "walk home while eating a taco in shame" places, but the food is well worth the shame. Try the chicken nachos, Sho nuff.

I come here all the time.. like when i am working in the area.. its cheap and I think its very good flavorful tacos n burritos...the burrito is huge! I always add avocado n cilantro in mine...its always empty when i come.. I don't care to be honest my food comes out quilt that's all that matters. Yea the girl texts and is "out there" but she reconizes me since I come every week lol...its not a 5 star place people u shouldn't expect "proper" ettiquitte. I always get my chips and salsa but i rather not? They always give it to me.. I don't decline as I might feel rude about it.. but I just want my burritos n I'm satisfied. :) feed me I'm hungry! :)

Drunk and hungover? Stranded on the streets at 3am from a bar and looking for some cheap Mexican? You've found it. Speaking as a college student who is on a budget yet still knows how to party and eat well, Allende has served me well after parties, 20min break between classes at DePaul and as a hangout place with friends. Everything is too ridiculously cheap for Lincoln Park neighborhood. You can't go wrong with ordering 2 or even 3 dishes per person because it's that cheap ($2-$4 per entree) if you're REALLY hungry and going for it. Not another fatty/greasy Mexican place. It's what you'd expect out of a cheap college Mexican place. A little... quickie on your stomach.  PS. Agua de horchata is the best. Serves both as a beverage and dessert.

Great food that keeps you wanting back, although me and my friends highly dislike the lady at the counter. She's rude and is either a) texting b)   talking on the phone c) or just being noisy looking out the window or hearing customers conversations.

This is a decent little place.  It's  not too far from home, and it's a good "I need a taco" place when I'm hungry.  I've had better tacos elsewhere, but honestly, I've had much much worse, and this place fits the bill of "OK".   One thing I've noticed is that each visit, this place is always empty... not usually a good sign, but I've not been disappointed.
Good sober, better drunk. Considering I'm sober it's a 3 star. But it's cheap, quick and open late. Awesome after a late night of partying!

There are plenty of reviews attesting Allende's deliciousness.  Rather than another similar review, I'm going to leave you with a haiku: Mexican done right Flautas crispy yet tender Hot sauce wicked good Enjoy!

The burrito I had here was just OK.  I've had much better veggie burritos as other places around town, such as Angela's on Clark.  These guys use all the ingredients I like... but I don't know somehow it just didn't pack the flavor I expected. They also didn't give me any chips and salsa even though I ate there.  They were supposed to, right? Well good thing is another one down... only a bazillion more places to try.

I was really excited to stumble upon this place seeing all the great yelp reviews.  I typically travel from Old Town to North Lakeview to my sweet, sweet, dirty lover El Palmar for mexican, but was hoping Allende could save me some travel time and shame of taking a $15 cab just so my nachos (or my baby as I refer to them) stay warm in transit from restaurant to couch to belly.  Alas, no such luck. I was there on a Sunday evening around 9pm.  Two other young couples were eating at the time, no line no wait.  I ordered steak burrito no beans.  Once home I unwrapped it excited like a kid at Christmas.  It was in no way huge as described by some.  It was normal burrito size. The steak didn't taste like steak much, standard flavor and was not at all a fan of their slasa.  They only have one type to choose from that I was offered at least.  Call me crazy (or just fat) but I love me some salsa variety, I like super spicy green salsa the most and her was a thick dark red concontion.  It was completely edible, but I didn't have that "oh my god that was so good I don't care that I can't fit into my jeans tomorrow" feeling.   An open letter to El Palmar. I'm sorry I cheated on you.  I should have known better.  Everytime I stray I just want to be back in your chair, watching your spanish soap operas and not caring that I am eating like a man going to the chair. Never. Again.
Great Food! Ask for a side of the HOT SAUCE! The best hot sauce I ever had.

I prefer the Allende up the street. I believe it's the owner's daughter that operates the counter at Allende 2 and she's just nowhere near as awesome as the Senora. But this is still good Mexican food (and GREAT salsa) for cheap.
very friendly service great guac.

I've been going to Allendes for the past six years and converting loyal followers in the meantime. Their chips and salsa are so delicious - the perfect combo of crunchy tomatoey kick to your tastebuds, and what makes the deal even better is they're free when you eat in. Even though I'd love to branch out to try they're nachos, huevos y chorizo, and other delicacies, I can't seem to get away from their tacos and burritos.  Al pastor, carne, pollo --- all of them are so good and filling. Since living in Mexico, I've become quite a stickler for authenticity (in other words, Chipotle is a no go), but these tortillas wrapped around refried beans, avocado, carne, plus salsa put the MMMM in Mexican Food. The horchata is a smooth summer treat and the service is fast without being scary. Looking for a no frills Mexican spot?  Look no further than late night Allendes. Oh and get their cheese fries while you're at... no, seriously... you Have to try their cheese fries.

Totally decent taco joint. Tips: - At certain times of the day, little shit high school kids will come in and be extremely annoying.  The staff is indifferent. - Has the crappy situation where your server takes your order and then you sit while they bring it to you.  All of the tipping but none of the service. - I've forgotten to pay and walked out several times.  Staff was indifferent.  Only slightly relieved when I showed up later to settle up.

kudos to the staff for not taking lip from drunk fools. "chicken.  i just ... want something with chicken," my slightly inebriated friend says/slurs.  "you choose." the woman at the register engages in a staring competition with my now nearly asleep friend.  she stares at her and does not blink an eye.  she is strong.  she stands her ground as firm as a statue.  she judges our folly (as well she should). eventually, i step in and order a taco and a torta.  the food will not haunt my dreams, but her steely eyes, unwilling to retreat -- that i will never forget.

Simple, amazing burritos. They always deliver on my expectations of savory meaty goodness without complicating the process. And they don't ask too many questions about what you do or don't want on it. I just want a carne asada burrito, not a bunch of questions on what it should or should not include. They know. Dependable and delicious always gets five stars.

I could sit and eat the tortilla chips and salsa all night long. And I think some of the DePaul kids eating there at the same time I was were doing just that. Maybe they ordered a taco three hours prior, I don't know. Really tasty food - forget about the big chains, just come here and get filled up for cheap. It's also hysterical to watch some of the more impaired clientele as the night lingers on...

Chicken burrito here is Awesome (with a capital A).  I always get extra sauce - I don't know exactly what it is, but it is fantastic - smokey, robust, spicy, but not too spicy.  Puts Chipotle's burritos to shame.  And their prices are right, and reasonable/low, good quantities of food too.  Chips & guac are good.  Milkshakes, eh... definitely not their strong point.  I can't recommend those.  In fact, I would say, don't order the shakes, just order more food instead.

I live really close to Allende and their open late so I go there a lot. My favorite thing on the menu is the Veggie Burrito and their homemade hot salsa that comes with the food (I always ask for two). The menu is very diverse and it is super cheap. The late night staff is the best.. it is always the same two people and they are really nice especially when you think about all the drunks they have to deal with from the bars on Lincoln.

I'm a DePaul Alum. So of course, I've spent many a night at Allende. The team at Allende can whip up some darn good tacos, tostadas, tortas and burritos. I personally enjoy the steak tacos the authentic way, with only onions, cilantro, and a lime wedge. The rice and beans, served on the side, are arguably the best rice and beans I've ever had in a Mexican restaurant. And as long as you order something to eat, you'll get a bottomless basket of tortilla chips with the tastiest salsa this side of 26th Street.  The good thing about Allende is that every female working there is named Maria. So you can feel right at home and address these muchachas by their first name. Que bueno. I would give Allende 5 stars, however, it loses 1 star for the uncomfortable run-ins with the drunks of Lincoln Park. After hours, Allende is crowded and awkward. The staff is friendly and fast no matter what, so the service won't change. But if you went to DePaul, be prepared to see some of those "super seniors" who still frequent the bars on Lincoln Ave. and this delicious taco joint afterwards.

What is decent Mexican food at 9pm becomes EXCELLENT Mexican food by 4am.  The late hours, prime location, and staff experienced with the late-night college crowd can come in handy when the need arises.  And let's be honest with ourselves, the need for late-night Mexican can arise quite often.  If, after a long night out, you want to avoid light, noise, crowds, and long bathroom waits, you may want to steer clear of Allendes.  But if you can tolerate the above, I welcome you to the long, growing list of Allendes afficionados.

I love Allende!  Inexpensive, but GREAT Mexican food ready in a snap!  Plus, they are open from 9 AM - 3 AM on Sun-Thurs and Fri and Sat are open from 9 AM - 5 AM.  Not a fancy place for sure, but the service is great and the food is very good. It is perfect for those late nights when everything else is closed, as well as all of the other times they are open. Vive Allende!

The perfect, cheap, authentic mexican joint.  You can't go wrong, especially since it's open late... Quesadillas are mini, order more than one for sure. Have tried both locations, as a tip: this one seems to be less crammed during after hours, that or it has more seating. I am filled with joy anytime 2 o'clock rolls around and someone mutters the word, "Allende."

This place is great for some good cheap food. Go late night or for lunch if your in lincoln park. I always enjoy the Torta with steak but most of their menu is good. If you eat in they are very nice, give you chips and water, a great break from the bars. This place might look like a dive, and it may be, but it is one of the best dives around. Would highly suggest it to anyone.
late night taco run? Yes yes yes yes!!! They are great here because not only do they give you endless free chips but they also are just really nice in general.  The salsa is the best!

"dos carne asada tacos con lechuga y tomate para aqui" Maria taught me how to say that in Spanish! How cool is that?  She also rates whatever friends/girls I drag in and gives you free chips and salsa if you can recite the Spanish alphabet backwards (or you can just sit down, that works too). I tried the rice water once, on a whim, not knowing what it is.  It tasted like liquid big red gum, which we all know is pretty good, but not as good as juicy fruit. P.S. Only been here drunk like everybody else, so maybe I'm seeing double, but it's worth the 5 stars just for the experience ... P.P.S. Bathroom availability directly proportional to how awesome you are

Some incredibly rude woman works the counter. I was asking a legitimate question and she looked at me like a fool, and i wasn't being some smug, drunken, schmuck. it was all her Oh, and most importantly, this food will do HORRIBLE things to your digestive system. I think i've finally learned my lesson and won't be back again.

This is the best burrito joint I've ever been to - HANDS DOWN. Anytime I'm in the area we stop in and order 3 steak burritos to go (there are only 2 of us).. yep they are that good not to mention pretty cheap for Lincoln Park! And now I'm craving a steak burrito - great.. :) Oh, I have to mention the great hours (open late)

I go here all the time so I was surprised to see I hadn't written a review yet. This place is AWESOME! As all Mexican places I judge this entirely on my horchata and tacos (my usual go to when trying a new Mexican place). Love it! Also great, the burritos and tortas (both are HUGE) and they give you free chips and salsa when you eat in (we do when it's early, I don't care for the drunks so it's pick up only at night when the drunks are out). Open late, affordable & serves horchata. I can't ask for more.

Totally dive Mexican joint on Lincoln, near the Victory Gardens Theater, just north of Webster. Awesome tacos and burritos. Haven't tried the other stuff, but I'm sure it is great too. Open very late (4 am?).  I never have to worry about not having any groceries in the house, because I can *always* stumble up the block to Allende and find them open. One of my favorite places in town. And VERY cheap. There is also a location further up Lincoln, across from the Biograph, but I haven't tried that one.

Inexpensive, and yummy. I had the steak torta, and it was pretty darn good.  Next time I come, it's onto the tacos for me - I will be trying la lengua. Maybe I was in a spicy mood, or maybe they just gave me the gringa-style hot sauce, but it wasn't nearly as hot as I would have liked, or would have thought.
Best Mexican food I've had in a long time and cheap too! Definitely go here.
Best burrito in the city. End of story.  Steak burrito.  Get it. Love it. if you don't like hot sauce, this is not your place.

You can go anywhere in Chicago and not find better tacos for the price. Most everything on the menu is pretty solid, but the tacos are as good as it gets, period. They are ultra generous with the cheese and sour cream and it all comes together every time.  I have been everywhere and late night taco places do not get any better than allende.

I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place! This is my favorite place to go to get an inexpensive, fresh, tasty Mexican meal.  And ... yay, lucky me! ... it's a block and a half from my home. The prices are reasonable and everything is prepared  quickly and it's always fresh!   The place is not a fancy restaurant.  In fact, it's almost a dive.  But I don't go there for the decor.  :) My favorite is the steak taco with the works.  I usually order two with a can of Diet Coke.  If you sit at a table to eat it they'll bring you a basket of tortilla chips and a bowl of fresh salsa, which I like a lot  (not to be  confused with the hot sauce, mentioned by another reviewer, which is thicker and definitely much hotter).   The burritos (favored by my boyfriend) are massive and  do not contain rice (like those served at Chipotle).  The enchilada dinner with refried beans and rice is also very good. The service is good.  They bring you your order and then leave you alone.  Let's face it, this is not a fancy restaurant with waiters and bus boys.  You pay when you're done eating or you can pay up front when you order; it's up to you. BTW, I just read a review that mentioned a lady who works at night who is a scam artist.  I'm not sure which person they are talking about but I only know of 2 women who work there.  One of them is an older woman who works the afternoon shift and a younger woman who works the evening shift.  I don't know either of their names but they are both very nice and always charge me exactly as priced on the menu. And yes, I have gone in there on many a late night, slightly tipsy, and have never been overcharged.

Best veggie tacos around. They are loaded with fresh veggies, crisp cold sour cream and perfectly cooked taco shell. Everything is balanced perfectly and you will drool after eating one of these bad boys.  Their horchata (for all you Americans out there; rice water) is just fair. Nothing special. But then again, horchata tastes differently each time depending on how much cinnamon and such in there.  Their quesadillas are fab, especially if you add sour cream. They add it just enough so it warms it up a tad and its runs out the side of the quesadilla. Amazing.  Good for late night eats although the only downside is that is it hard to park...regardless of the time of day. Worse when all the drunks are out.  Cheap, tasty, delicious.

At least this place FINALLY takes credit cards!!! Allende is the best place for Mexican food in this area of Lincoln Park.  Portions are huge, food is excellent, and prices are low.  I love the veggie burrito here...... its my fave work-time lunch. This location can get a little crazy at lunchtime with Lincoln Park High kids... so avoid between11-1 for the most part.

Generally pretty good. It depends on what time of day or night you go there. When there's more drunks in there  the food quality will be much lower than on, say, a wednesday night. I would highly suggest the tacos, they are quite delicious and very fresh. It has been in Lincoln Park for quite a while, so if you go to DePaul, I suggest you get really drunk and stumble in their at about 4:40AM to get the true experience.

The tastiest burritos in Chicago! Yeah- I said it! I've had 'em all over the country, and Allende's stands up to the Pepsi challenge every time!   My favorite's the chicken burrito with avocado.  Their fresh ingredients are what separate them from the other taquerias.   And the nicest burrito Lady in town!

Awesome burritos and so cheap. Allende is the bomb! Open late for those who need something to absorb all the alcohol they consumed on Lincoln Ave. I am almost ashamed to admit I used to frequent Chipotle which in my opinion is like Americanized Mexican food. Then I discovered this little gem in the neighborhood! Waaaaayyyy better and more authentic too. I love the mural of the little man on the horse.

Yes up late, drinking late, out late, wherever, whenever before 3am. Come on and get some great bites of burritos and nachos here!! Mmmm thank you thank you thank you. Location location location. Always a lively crowd of people here late at night. Aye aye aye.

It's the littlest of things that distinguish one taqueria from the next.  Here it's the thick, smoky, chipotle salsa and 3 fresh juicy lime wegdes (one per taco) wrapped up in a piece of foil that came with my carry-out order.

To be fair, I'm a big fan of the late night burrito and Allende has long been one of my favorite post-bar stops.  BUT BEWARE: I have noticed recently that the woman that works the register every night is a HUGE SCAM ARTIST!!! She will majorly overcharge anyone that looks like they're either drunk OR an unsuspecting first-time costumer. I'm so sick of being ripped off that I won't go to this location anymore. I'll either go to the one farther up Lincoln or Taco Burrito Palace II on Halsted. At those places I don't need to worry about getting charged $20 for nachos and a veggie burrito.

OOOOOOOOO. I love me some Allende. Upon moving to Chicago years ago I was guided towards Allende. Everytime I eat here I come out stuffed full of delicious Mexican food. I reccommend burritos, tacos, and tortas. I mix it up and I am never dissapointed with their food.

Allende is right around the corner from my house and open late, which are probably the 2 main reasons I'm a fan. I love being able to come home after a late night out and grab a tasty burrito. Allende serves all of the standard Mexican staples and serves breakfast too. I've had the veggie burrito, quesadilla and the nachos and all have been very good. Their prices are also really reasonable too, which is an added bonus. The only real negative about this place is the "salsa" they rightfully call hot sauce because (1) it is quite hot and (2) it has more of a thick ketchup consistency, than a chunky salsa, which I prefer (if I grab my food to go I usually use my own salsa at home). Note: Skip the cheese fries, it's just chihuaha cheese melted over fries. So not worth the price!
